PRM_IDX PIN NAME
NC_IDX_EF_RI PIN_EF_RI // right electrical-?ap (PWM-driven)

NC_IDX_EF_PNM PIN_EF_PNM // one right pneumatic-?ap (LV-driven)
Initialisation: at reset:
#If NLC_EF_DYN_CONF_1 == 1
#Then DNC_EF_NR = NR_EF_VAR_COD
#Else DNC_EF_NR = NC_EF_NR
#Endif
If NR_EF_VAR_COD == 2
And (C_VEH_TYPE_CONF & NC_VEH_TYPE_CAJUN)
Then
LV_EF_SPT_MOD = 1
Else
LV_EF_SPT_MOD = 0
EndIf

EGPA, EGPA actuator diagnosis
23.2 EGPA actuator diagnosis
� Data De?nition
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
CDN_DIAG_PNM_EF [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 7H 0 ...7 1 -
Primary Diagnosis condition read from the infrastructure for each symptom of PNM_EF; bit0: diagnosis condition for symptom
SYM_0 (SCP), bit1: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_1 (SCG), bit2: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_2 (OC)
CDN_DIAG_PWM_EF [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 7H 0 ...7 1 -
Primary Diagnosis condition read from the infrastructure for each symptom of PWM_EF; bit0: diagnosis condition for symptom
SYM_0 (SCP), bit1: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_1 (SCG), bit2: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_2 (OC)
CTR_PWM_EF_FB_1 [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Counter for EF failure feedback signal: failure number 1
CTR_PWM_EF_FB_2 [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Counter for EF failure feedback signal: failure number 2
CTR_PWM_EF_FB_3 [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Counter for EF failure feedback signal: failure number 3
CTR_PWM_EF_FB_MAX V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Interpolation result of IP_CTR_PWM_EF_FB: failure feedback counter
CTR_T_PWM_EF_FB_WRT [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Counter for sporadic t-low times of the EF feedback diagnosis
ERR_DIAG_PNM_EF [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 7H 0 ...7 1 -
Raw value of error symptom for PNM_EF detected on interface ECU and EF control unit; bit0: diagnosis condition for symptom
SYM_0 (SCP), bit1: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_1 (SCG), bit2: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_2 (OC)
ERR_DIAG_PWM_EF [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 7H 0 ...7 1 -
Raw value of error symptom for PWM_EF detected on interface ECU and EF control unit; bit0: diagnosis condition for symptom
SYM_0 (SCP), bit1: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_1 (SCG), bit2: diagnosis condition for symptom SYM_2 (OC)
ERR_PWM_EF_FB [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Failure status of the failure feedback coming from the EF control unit (00H: no failure; 01H: failure detected by EF control unit; FFH:
init value/feedback possible); failure 01H only valid, if LV_PWM_EF_FB_VLD = 1
LV_PWM_EF_FB_VLD [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
If LV_PWM_EF_FB_VLD = 1, then failure number is valid
LV_T_PWM_EF_FB_WRT [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Sporadic error bit for t_low times of the EF feedback diagnosis
STATE_EL_MVB_EF [NC_EF_NR] O/V 0... FH 0... 15 1 -
State of the Exhaust ?ap
STATE_PWM_EF_FB [NC_EF_NR] V 0... 4H 0 ...4 1 -
STATE of failure feedback recognition

.. FH 0... 15 1 -

Time with PWM_EF >C_PWM_EF_MIN_FB necessary to have failure feedback from EF control unit
T_PWM_EF_ECU [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 25500 100 ms
Timer counting t_pwm for failure feedback recognition
T_PWM_EF_FB [NC_EF_NR] V 0... FFH 0... 25500 100 ms
Timer counting t_low for failure feedback recognition

23.2.1 Diagnostic information from infrastructure
� General Information
Index i corresponds to exhaust ?ap number (0...DNC_EF_NR-1).
The EF control unit is controlled by a PWM signal line or Digital signal line driven by the ATIC 94. The driver
can distinguish between three symptoms:
?Short circuit to Vbatt?, ?Short circuit to GND? and ?Open Load?.
This function reads the failure information (ERR_DIAG_PWM_EF[i]/ERR_DIAG_PNM_EF[i]) from the infrastruc-
ture.
The digital signal driven EF is called pneumatic ?ap.
The PWM signal driven EF is called electrical ?ap.

(only the PWM driven EF has a feedback diagnosis)

Index i corresponds to exhaust ?ap number (0...DNC_EF_NR-1).
For the recognition of the failure feedback the information, if a failure ?short circuit to ground?
is detected on the signal line between ECU and EF control unit is used.
If a failure is detected from the EF control unit, a failure feedback is send to the ECU by pulling
the signal line (interface ECU to the EF control unit) to ground in de?nite pattern. The time to low
gives an information about the failure number. A complete failure feedback is detected if also the
speci?c time t_PWM is detected.

According the failure feedback received from the EF control unit, different failures
can be distinguished. A failure is identi?ed by a speci?c t_low time (T_PWM_EF_FB[i]).
The time is de?ned by the time difference between two failures (C_T_PWM_EF_FB_OFS_1/2/3).
For a good accuracy a failure recognition window is de?ned with C_T_PWM_EF_FB_WIN.
Figure 23.2.3:
Additional to the speci?c time t_low a failure feedback also consists of a speci?c time t_PWM.
This time is de?ned by the absolute time T_PWM_EF_ECU[i]. For a good accuracy a window is
de?ned with C_T_PWM_EF_FB_WIN.
Figure 23.2.4:
If the time difference between two failures ?t not to C_T_PWM_EF_FB_OFS_1/2/3, a sporadic
error could be detected.

Index i corresponds to exhaust ?ap number (0...DNC_EF_NR-1).
If a failure is detected by the EF control unit, a failure feedback is send to the ECU.
According the possible failure feedback from the EF control unit (de?ned by ERR_PWM_EF_FB[i] and LV_PWM_
EF_FB_VLD[i]), the diagnosis can manage the following failures: Feedback failure 1 or 2 or 3
or sporadic error.
If n times sequentially (with n = IP_CTR_PWM_EF_FB) a failure feedback for the same failure is detected,
the failure is set. The diagnostic data are only reset to 0 at the event reset and error management reset!

CTR_PWM_EF_FB_3[i] = 0
CTR_PWM_EF_FB_MAX = 0
Activation: LV_VAR_EF == 1
Deactivation: LV_VAR_EF == 0
Recurrence: 100ms

23.3.2.1.7.1 ACTION call for the electrical exhaust ?ap
The action INFR_SetPWMDucyEf is responsible for controlling the exhaust ?ap corresponding the condition of
LV_EF. This ?ap is either open or close i.e. logical 0 or 1. The PWM value for the ?ap is de?ned by C_PWM_EF_
OPEN/_CLOSE. To avoid wrong states of the EF due to sampling errors, it is recommended to set the PWM for
OPEN and CLOSE to unambiguous values (e.g. OPEN: 20%; CLOSE: 80%).
The variable IDX_POW_CLAS_EF selects the corresponding value depending on code of power class (vehicle
power).

## Function

The primary function of this system is **EGPA actuator diagnosis**. It processes various input signals and internal parameters to determine the operational state, validity, and specific error status of the EGPA actuator's Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) feedback. This involves identifying hardware-detected faults (like Short Circuit to Ground - SCG) and potentially other timing-related anomalies in the PWM feedback signal.
